result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard W Kirby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: 15CM238

miscConds.notes: Bond shall be applied towards fines and costs, any remaining balance shall be applied towards the fines and costs in 15CM238.  If there is any bond remaining it shall be returned to whomever posted it.  If there are any fines and costs remaining in 15CM238 after bond has been applied, the remaining amount due shall be paid as a condition of probation in this case.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment and treatment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens of his blood, breath, or urine.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard W Kirby

15A 101810 
Per JOC remaining bond on 15CM559 to be applied to fees/costs on 15CM238

Def in person & by Atty Wilfred P De Junco.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1.  Joint recommendation; Statements from State, Defense; Court proceeds to sentencing
Reset Hearing from Branch I to Branch 3 on 07-27-2015 at 09:45 am for resolution with 15CM238 per counsel.
15R 011625  Bond receipted at Clerk of Courts Office

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Alyssa Armbrust State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (15CM238 Br. 3)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  SPD will represent.  State request $1,500-2,000.00 cash bond, counsel advises the defendant does not have means to post cash bond and in process of applying for disability and request a signature bond or a couple hundred dollars.  Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
